content.raw:
Not sure if this is introduced in this PR but:

1. Insert a box and edit it

2. In the editor, scale it down a bit, save and exit

3. In simulation, it is smaller than in the editor

pullrequest.title: Fix scale issue in copy and paste

content.raw:
Another issue during simulation:

1. Insert a box

2. Scale it down in Y

3. Copy & paste it

4. Scale down the copy in Z

5. Copy & paste the copy - the preview shows up with the wrong Y scale but once you place it it has the correct scale.
content.html:
Another issue during simulation:

  1. Insert a box

  2. Scale it down in Y

  3. Copy & paste it

  4. Scale down the copy in Z

  5. Copy & paste the copy - the preview shows up with the wrong Y scale but once you place it it has the correct scale.

content.raw: If I remember well, the scale (geometry size) on the inspector used to update in real time as you scaled in the model editor, right? It's not updating now.

content.raw: found to be issue when scaling a cloned link in model editor. Fixed and added few more tests in 8fd935b. [jenkins clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/496/testReport/)

pullrequest.title: Fix scale issue in copy and paste

content.raw: I always find `find_last_of` confusing because it finds **any** of the characters in the `::` string. I believe you want to find the whole substring `::`. Could you use `rfind`?
content.html: I always find find_last_of confusing because it finds any of the characters in the :: string. I believe you want to find the whole substring ::. Could you use rfind?
